name: discreditable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
causing or likely to cause a loss of respect for a person, group, or idea: Their tactics were highly discreditable. Defence lawyers may try to bring up discreditable incidents in the victim's life. See
discredit
More examplesFewer examplesHe certainly did not do anything discreditable.The president was complicit in the whole discreditable affair.The report attempted to conceal anything discreditable to the company.This is one of the more discreditable parts of our history.There is nothing discreditable in the instinct to protect one's family.
